name: Source
description: The Source class contains information about the possible source(s) of the event(s) that generated an alert.  An event may have more than one source (e.g., in a distributed denial-of-service attack).

Node.name: Node
Node.description: Information about the host or device that appears to be causing the events (network address, network name, etc.).

User.name: User
User.description: Information about the user that appears to be causing the event(s).

Process.name: Process
Process.description: Information about the process that appears to be causing the event(s).

Service.name: Service
Service.description: Information about the network service involved in the event(s).

ident.name: ident
ident.description: A unique identifier for this source; see Section 3.2.9.

spoofed.name: spoofed
spoofed.description: An indication of whether the source is, as far as the analyzer can determine, a spoofed address used for hiding the real origin of the attack.  The permitted values for this attribute are shown below.  The default value is "unknown".  (See also Section 10.)

values.description: Source is believed to be a decoy

interface.name: interface
interface.description: May be used by a network-based analyzer with multiple interfaces to indicate which interface this source was seen on.
